author: Tim Stelloh
description: The conduct of a former Massachusetts state trooper who was fired over his handling of the Karen Read murder investigation took centerstage at her retrial this week as defense lawyers spent hours grilling the ex-officer’s supervisor.
title: Trooper fired over Karen Read investigation handled case with 'honor and integrity,' his supervisor says

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: A popular influencer who has been open about her abusive relationship with her ex-boyfriend received an outpouring of support online this week after he pleaded guilty in court.
title: TikToker Kayla Malec receives outpouring of support after announcing result of domestic assault case

author: The Politics Desk
description: In today’s edition, we examine John Fetterman’s place in the Senate, where the Pennsylvania Democrat is increasingly on an island.
title: John Fetterman finds himself on an island in the Senate: From the Politics Desk

author: Rich Schapiro
description: Jeanine Pirro is the first U.S. attorney nominee known to have come under a federal probe after being caught on tape scheming to catch a cheating spouse in the act.
title: Inside the salacious scandal that derailed Jeanine Pirro's political career

author: Viola Flowers
description: Clemson University President James Clements was floored -- literally -- by his daughter’s college graduation Thursday.
title: Clemson president is bowled over by his daughter's big moment

author: Sahil Kapur
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told congressional leaders on Friday that the U.S. will likely run out of borrowing authority by August.
title: Treasury Dept. asks Congress to raise debt ceiling before August to avert default

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: Newly elected Pope Leo XIV was born in Chicago and raised in the south suburb of Dolton, where his old house has become a point of pilgrimage.
title: The Windy City celebrates 'Da Pope'

author: David K. Li
description: The agent for Hall of Fame quarterback John Elway was killed in an "accident," Southern California investigators said Friday, nearly two weeks after a tragic golf cart fall.
title: Death of John Elway agent Jeff Sperbeck caused by 'blunt head trauma' and ruled an accident

author: The Associated Press
description: The new food colors will be approved for use in a range of foods from fruit drinks and yogurt to pretzels, ready-to-eat chicken and candies.
title: FDA will allow new color additives made from minerals, algae and flower petals

author: Jessica Dickler, CNBC
description: Americans have been worried about being able to maintain their standard of living since inflation first began to spike in 2021.
title: No buy, low buy, slow buy: How many consumers are preparing for an economic hit

author: Viola Flowers
description: Mikal Mahdi was executed on April 11, becoming the second man in South Carolina to be executed by a three-person firing squad this year after admitting to killing an off-duty police officer in 2004.
title: S.C. inmate's firing squad execution was 'botched,' with bullets mostly missing his heart, lawyers say

author: The Associated Press
description: As the measles outbreak in West Texas slows, other states are reporting multiple cases in communities with low vaccination rates.
title: The U.S. has 1,001 measles cases and 11 states with active outbreaks

author: Amelia Lucas, CNBC
description: Ferrero North America is adding peanuts to its Nutella, turning its Ferrero Rocher spheres into squares and adding Dr Pepper flavor to Tic Tacs, all in the hopes of winning over more U.S. consumers.
title: Candy giant Ferrero adds American twists to Nutella, Ferrero Rocher to fuel U.S. growth

author: Melanie Zanona
description: President Donald Trump’s last-minute push to raise taxes on the wealthiest Americans is running into a buzzsaw of opposition in the Republican Party.
title: Trump's float of a tax hike for the wealthy quickly runs into GOP resistance

author: Allan Smith
description: In the run-up to the vote to confirm Pete Hegseth as defense secretary, Sen.
title: An isolated John Fetterman clashes with colleagues and staff as he skips his Senate duties

author: Suzy Khimm
description: The FDA has not published more than a dozen letters that flagged hazards at food companies, including potential contamination, two sources said.
title: FDA stalls in posting food safety warning letters amid staff cuts

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Police in Worcester, Massachusetts, held a young girl's face to the ground as U.S.
title: Massachusetts police hold girl's face to the ground as ICE arrests her mother, video shows

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: After a season marred with injury and declining statistics, Darius Garland is ready to lead the Cleveland Cavaliers deep into the playoffs.
title: The Cavaliers need Darius Garland to overcome adversity one more time

author: David K. Li
description: A Fox News Channel analyst fainted on air Thursday night in mid-sentence of her harsh critique of the Biden administration, forcing a show host to awkwardly try going to another guest before heading to break.
title: Fox News analyst faints and falls out of chair on air, host tries to carry on with show

author: Adam Reiss
description: Sean “Diddy” Combs committed “domestic violence” in his relationship with one of the accusers expected to testify at his sex trafficking trial, the hip-hop mogul’s lead attorney told a federal judge Friday.
title: Sean Combs’ lawyer says rapper admits to ‘domestic violence’ in relationship

author: Chloe Atkins
description: Rumeysa Öztürk, the Tufts University student detained by immigration agents in March, was ordered to be released from ICE custody following a hearing Friday.
title: Tufts student Rumeysa Öztürk ordered to be released immediately from ICE custody by judge

author: Ben Kamisar
description: Pope Leo XIV, the first American to ascend to the papacy, has voted in three Republican primary elections since 2012, state voting records show.
title: Chicago-born Pope Leo XIV cast a ballot in recent Republican primaries in Illinois

author: Shane Bishop
description: Six weeks before a masked intruder slipped inside a rental home on the edge of the University of Idaho campus and fatally stabbed four students, Bryan Kohberger was coming under pressure.
title: Searches and selfies: Idaho college murder suspect Bryan Kohberger's online habits emerge in new details

author: Jay Blackman
description: Radar screens serving Newark Liberty International Airport went black early Friday morning, raising more air traffic safety concerns at the busy New Jersey hub, federal authorities said.
title: Radar screens that serve troubled Newark Liberty International Airport briefly go dark

author: Akshay Syal, M.D.
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday approved the first at-home test to screen for cervical cancer, Teal Health, which makes the test kit, said.
title: FDA approves at-home HPV test to screen for cervical cancer

author: Patrick Smith
description: The 11 high school lacrosse players accused of tying up a younger teammate in remote woodland as part of a hazing ritual last month regret their actions, their attorney said Thursday.
title: High school lacrosse players accused of hazing 'deeply regret' their actions, attorney says

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Another dangerous TikTok challenge has prompted urgent warnings from school districts and law enforcement agencies nationwide, and led to a 15-year-old New Jersey student being charged with arson.
title: TikTok prank 'Chromebook Challenge' prompts warnings from schools after laptops are set on fire

author: Denise Chow
description: A defunct, Soviet-era spacecraft is falling back to Earth uncontrolled, but experts say there’s little cause for alarm.
title: A half-ton Soviet spacecraft is about to crash into Earth, but don't panic

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: Retired Supreme Court Justice David Souter, a lifelong bachelor who was renowned for his love of a simple life in New Hampshire and dislike of Washington, died on Thursday at the age of 85, according to a Supreme Court statement.
title: David Souter, ‘stealth’ Supreme Court justice who disappointed conservatives, dies at 85

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: The family, now in Mexico, is garnering support from some members of Congress as they prepare to apply for humanitarian parole, hoping the 11-year-old can resume her treatment in the U.S.
title: Deported family of U.S. citizen girl recovering from rare brain tumor are  determined to return

author: Steve Kopack
description: President Donald Trump has signaled a willingness to drastically cut the U.S. current 145% tariff rate on China ahead of trade talks between the two countries.
title: Trump signals he is open to cutting China tariffs to 80% ahead of trade negotiations

author: Courtney Reagan, CNBC
description: America’s supply chain is under attack.
title: Cargo thieves are attacking the U.S. supply chain at alarming rates

author: Julia Zhong
description: Eighty-five years after his ticket was first issued for a similar event, a man was allowed to use it at this year's World Expo in Japan.
title: Man admitted to Japan's World Expo with 85-year-old ticket

description: Father Peter Donohue, the president of Villanova University, joins TODAY to share how he learned about the election of Pope Leo XIV. "I was actually in a restaurant in Chicago having lunch with some friends. I screamed in this restaurant!" He also shares his insight into what Pope Leo is like as a person. “He’s very simple. He’s very gentle. He’s not boastful at all. He’s a very intelligent man,” he says.
title: Villanova president on learning Leo XIV became pope: 'I screamed'

author: Mithil Aggarwal
description: Fears are swelling of an all-out war between India and Pakistan amid questions over how much of a mediating role the United States will be able to play.
title: Trump and Vance would rather stay out of it as India and Pakistan spiral towards war

description: President Donald Trump expressed optimism about trade talks with China in Geneva this weekend. "They want to make a deal very badly,” he said in the Oval Office. This comes as the first trade agreement was made with the United Kingdom, the first since his sweeping tariffs. NBC’s Garrett Haake reports for TODAY.
title: Trump hints at lowering tariffs on China as trade talks set to kick off

author: Tim Stelloh
description: A judge is expected to rule Friday on the effort to remove Los Angeles County’s top prosecutor from Erik and Lyle Menendez’s bid to reduce their prison sentences after their defense team accused the district attorney of bias.
title: Judge to rule whether DA should be thrown off Menendez brothers' resentencing bid

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Robert Francis Prevost, now known as Pope Leo XIV, has been selected to lead the world's 1.4 billion Catholics.
title: Leo XIV leads first Mass and Trump suggests taxes for the wealthy: Morning Rundown

author: Keir Simmons
description: Russia marked the 80th anniversary of the Soviet Union’s victory over Nazi Germany in World War II on Friday with a parade attended by China's Xi Jinping.
title: Xi and Putin vow stronger ties at Russia's WWII Victory Day parade ahead of U.S.-China trade talks

author: Alexander Smith
description: Pope Leo XIV has inherited a raging battle for not only the soul of the Catholic Church, but also its place in the geopolitical world.
title: A world on fire and shifting demographics: the issues in Pope Leo XIV's in-tray

author: The Associated Press
description: A federal judge has awarded a total of more than $680,000 to 17 families who say they were sickened by a 2021 jet fuel leak into a Navy drinking water system in Hawaii.
title: Judge awards $680K to 17 families exposed to jet fuel-tainted water at Hawaii Naval base

author: The Associated Press
description: Lainey Wilson took home the top prize at the 60th annual Academy of Country Music Awards for a second year in a row.
title: Lainey Wilson rules the 2025 Academy of Country Music Awards once again, Alan Jackson is honored

author: Corky Siemaszko
description: Back in 2019, James Manfredonia and some of his former Little League teammates thought they would finally be able to confront the coach who they allege abused them decades ago when they sued him under New York’s Child Victims Act.
title: A law was supposed to help child sex abuse victims — but thousands of cases remain in limbo

author: Natasha Korecki
description: Some politicos are wondering whether Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker's potential 2028 bid will be diminished if his chosen candidate, Juliana Stratton, doesn't win the Senate race.
title: Illinois Senate race buzz is about a person not on the ballot: JB Pritzker and his 2028 ambitions

author: Ken Dilanian
description: Supporters of the new director say he is bringing needed change. Some current and former FBI and DOJ officials worry he is not taking the job seriously enough.
title: Kash Patel's new way of leading the FBI: Fewer morning intel briefings, more pro sports events

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: The Arizona Democrat says he has a message that can help his party reach voters it has lost ground with in recent elections.
title: With a trip to Pennsylvania, Sen. Ruben Gallego enters the 2028 conversation

description: Hours after Pope Leo XIV was elected, Chicago’s Archdiocese predicted that the new pope would be a “voice for the voiceless,” adding that he is going to serve with “great faith.” Father Gregory Sakowicz went on to say that he thinks Pope Leo XIV will “be very strong” on immigration, human rights and the Earth.
title: Chicago Archdiocese predicts Pope Leo XIV will be a ‘voice for the voiceless’

author: The Associated Press
description: Wisconsin prosecutors have charged the father of a teenage girl who killed a teacher and fellow student in a school shooting last year with allowing her access to the semiautomatic pistols she used in the attack.
title: Father of 15-year-old who killed 2 at Wisconsin religious school faces felony charges

author: The Associated Press
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un supervised tests of short-range ballistic missile systems that simulated nuclear counterstrikes against U.S. and South Korean forces, state media said Friday.
title: North Korea says leader Kim supervised missile tests simulating nuclear strikes against rivals

author: Kyle Stewart
description: WASHINGTON—President Donald Trump fired the Librarian of Congress, Carla Hayden, on Thursday, according to a copy of her termination email obtained by NBC News.
title: Trump abruptly fires Librarian of Congress

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The liberal justice spoke at an event hosted by the American Bar Association, a legal group that has been targeted by the Trump administration.
title: Justice Sonia Sotomayor urges lawyers to 'stand up' amid Trump tumult

description: Louis and John Prevost, older brothers of Pope Leo XIV, share their feelings about his election as pope and settle the debate over whether the new pope is a fan of the Cubs or the White Sox.
title: ‘It’s just mind blowing’: Brothers of Pope Leo XIV share their reactions

author: The Associated Press
description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday allowed Trump to implement his ban on transgender people serving in the military while a legal challenge against it continues.
title: Up to 1,000 transgender troops are being moved out of the military in new Pentagon order

author: Corky Siemaszko
description: Learn more about Pope Leo XIV after he was selected to become the first American-born pontiff. Robert Francis Prevost grew up in Chicago and attended Villanova.
title: Pope Leo XIV's 'godly' path from Chicago to the Vatican
